comments.body: Yeah that would be a good addition
Tammyhunt69@rogers wants goats for Minecraft and wolves attack baby goats

WARNING! SPOILERS ABOUT NATURALLY GENERATED STRUCTURES

In desert and jungle temples there could be random chest and trap placement. 

Jungle temple Ex: Having the arrow dispenser on the top floor instead of down the stairs, but have it look the same on the outside.

Desert temple Ex: The TNT trap and chests at the bottom of tower(s) [split chests? two in one tower, two in other] instead of below the pyramid part.
I find updating the structures like they did in the village and pillage update is necessary since most of these structures havent been touched since they were added
You should be able to catch them in a bottle and take them home. They would stay with in the radius of amethyst crystals/blocks or a new block so that they won't run away
I think maybe after a while they could start to glow and using a bottle on them would make it a bottle o’ enchanting.
I agree, I also think that you could make copper a 4 ingot per block recipe also to cut the price in half.

Copper is too expensive to craft in my oppinion. And a soluntion to this maybe to make copper give you two ingots for every one ore.
Another problem I see is the very long names of the blocks.
Its too long.

Maybe a new workstation to melt metals in the shape, so it works exactly like stonecutter but it just looks different. Then you only need one copper block for each variety. No enchantments needed and no need to mine excessively.

i think the copper block should go back to being 9 ingots to a block like other storage blocks
instead the price reduction should be on the cut copper front of things 4 copper blocks > 16 cut copper blocks

What if you use 4 copper ingots to craft cut copper, which would be able to be placed in a stonecutter to make cut copper stairs and slabs, and you still use 9 copper ingots to make a block of copper?

Can copper blocks be redstone conductor? let's say if you place multiple copper blocks next to each other it carries the redstone signal to the other side. It's more expensive but it doubles the redstone signal distance of redstone dust and it can go straight up which normal redstone dust can't.

add more uses to copper or if its expensive to craft blocks or items then make them more common and add copper tools which can protect you from lightning but has the durability to chain armor and and the crafting recipe is unknown so someone else plz make an idea for that
make copper useful. for example, u can craft a bucket , mine cart tracks, tools, pots and much more
This is really neat.
Axolotls could eat it.
Give this man an award! Also the open bundle should over override picking up stuff if the item that is being picked up is in both the inventory and bundle

Keep in mind, diamonds are valuable because they are rare. In addition, when you get a certain amount of diamonds for your needs, your need for diamonds will decrease dramatically.
And if you don't like digging, then buy everything you need from the villagers.
thats the point of diamonds, to be rare
100% i can never find diamond
Diamonds are supposed to be rare.
mac nethrit betr
You can strip mine with 9 blocks in between your tunnels for maximum efficiency if you have trouble finding diamonds. If you mine constantly you can get up to 80 diamonds per hour
Just play 1.17
The only things you'll miss that aren't cave related are the mangrove swamp-related things and the new mountains
You can get datapacks that change cave generation to be like pre-1.18 caves.
Sería bueno yo extraño las antiguas cuevas y las generaciones
I agree. Too much caves will be inconvenient for creative mode players to build underground buildings.

Won't rebuy the game on my new system. They updated minecraft until they killed it and pushed people away. They should make it so you can toggle all the updates off and play the original minecraft on consoles
YES, this would be amazing and would add so much more life into Minecraft.
How am I seeing this now? I need this!

Maybe not with the mud bricks (since mud has a lot of water and would be washed away), but a sunken ancient city variant would give some incentive to explore aquifers. Maybe these cities will be less ruined than the ancient cities so unprepared players can risk drowning in structures vs finding treasure.

this Would Be Awesome!

It would be very cool having a decoration block called ignimbrite, which is a real vulcano thing
you just solved my mod

I can see this working like a water source but for lava.

The block would switch states, from solid (similiar to the current Magma Block) to a lava source block. The lava source block would flow down the side like an eruption.

When the eruption is over, the block would return from its flower state back to the solid state.

I'm not sure how you would make an "exploding" volcano, as it would need to continue to work while players dismantle the blocks. I can picture bubbling lava blocks that have extra partical effects.
Epic!  This is such a good idea!  maybe the volcanoes would generate with TNT inside!
we would have it if dream didn't rig the vote
i think the (i call it the chillager) should be added ASAP!
Me gustaría que añadieran alfombras que se puedan modificar.
I would like to see them spawn in the igloo structure where they would be able to sleep in the bed
That’s a great idea they should really make them like cats, tropical fish and pandas. All of these mobs at different variants two.
There's a lot of Axolotl variants and the idea of finding a glowing one would be cool
I think there should also be a "snowy" one, where its appearance is white, and survives near the ice.
What if when you bred two axolotls then you could have a chance for the colours of the parents to be mixed creating a colour hybrid.

Sure there is 5 variants and one of those 5 colours is the rare one but why not add 5 more like the green one and a red one maybe a one that on one side there is gold and on the other side there is the rare blue one
It’s been a long time since you have added a new animal so please add it
Good suggestion, but I think it's because you can't use a spyglass when you are moving the oars. Maybe if you use a spyglass in a boat it would slow you down.
Amazing idea and maybe it could have a new mob or to and some new types of plants and blocks

Thanks for the support if this gets enough votes it could become a possibility, so if you like it share this post with others.

Being on the top of a mountain doesn't make you hungry. It makes it harder to breathe. There's an oxygen mechanic already. Maybe oxygen would decrease really slowly at 220, and would decrease faster the higher you go. But if you don't move, you gain a bit back.

I really like the idea of using the breath holding mechanic when you're at high altitude! Maybe sneaking can help you catch your breath! The breath would need to be lost very very slowly compared to losing breath in water. Respiration and water breathing could both help!
Minecarts with Chests are a thing, that's kinda useful... (plus, transportation is very useful).
